intro: Gynura somalensis, commonly known as the Somali gynura, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its flowers are small and yellowish. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical study remains limited.
